text.p: These are the leading stories in the Malawi press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Malawi's three top political heavyweights, President Bakili Muluzi, main opposition Malawi Congress Party vice president Gwanda Chakuamba and former second vice president Chakufwa Chihana, leader of the opposition Alliance for Democracy, are expected to meet on Wednesday to discuss the country's fledgling democracy.

- Malawi Police are gearing for a contingency plan of action in preparation for hordes of Zambian asylum-seekers expected to flee their country when the November 18 general elections errupt into civil unrest.

- Lilongwe International Airport, the country's biggest airport, on Monday switched off navigation and landing aids in an effort to preserve the life span of the equipment but engineers said the move compromised flying safety standards.
- The ruling United Democratic Front party plots to buy-off some candidates of the opposition political parties contesting by-elections.
